resources.string: If you\'re enjoying Blacksmith, would you mind leaving a rating / review on the Play Store? It\'ll only take a sec, and you\'ll receive 500 gold!
Welcome to Blacksmith! This short tutorial will help you get started, and you\'ll be blacksmithing in no time.
Your coins are used for buying… well, everything. They are earned by trading away items.
This is your current level. XP is earned by buying, selling, crafting, and trading items.
Your first visitor has arrived! Tap him to continue.
Ah, Mr T Utorial! How nice of you to stop by.
It looks like this visitor prefers bronze items, and gives a 5% bonus if they are traded.
Each visitor has a list of demands. This one is for ores, tap the red button to open the trading window and see available items in your inventory.
Looks like you\'ve got 2 different ores to sell. How lucky! Sell them both, and you\'ll get more than the 2 coins listed due to the visitor\'s ore preference.
Once any 2 ores have been traded, tap finish to return to the visitor overview.
Hmm, looks like he wants some bars, and some unfinished items.. we haven\'t got those yet!
Let\'s leave the visitor, and make our way to the furnace.
Any bars that are currently being smelted in the furnace will appear here. If there\'s no space, no more bars can be made.
Time to open up the furnace, and make a bar for Mr T Utorial.
Item information is shown here. Generally, items can only be viewed after being created, but the bronze bar has been unlocked for you.
Swiping left and right will change between available items. For now though, they\'ll all be hidden.
Since this is a rather basic item, it only requires level 1. It also requires copper and tin ore, which we have plenty of.
Craft a few bronze bars, we\'ll need some extra for the unfinished items.
To make the bronze bars into the unfinished dagger, we only need to visit the anvil. As before, notice there\'s only 1 slot available for now.
Later, making finished items will require the use of the Crafting Table, and enchanting items will require visiting the Enchanting Table.
As in the furnace, all items are currently hidden apart from a basic bronze dagger. Luckily, that\'s what we need to make.
Unlike the furnace, there are different tiers of item in the anvil. Bronze is the lowest, then iron, all the way up to legendary items.
Hopefully, you\'ve got plenty of bronze bars made from the furnace. If not, better go back and make them!
Make a bronze dagger or two, but make sure to leave at least 1 bronze bar spare for trading.
Almost finished. Before you give Mr T his unfinished bronze dagger, we\'ll just cover a couple more key areas, then you can explore the game and figure it out yourself.
Whilst resources can be earned by completing visitors, most of your resources will come from buying things from traders in the market.
Sounds, music, and notifications can be turned on & off here. A message history is also available, along with optional google play achievements, leaderboard, and cloud saves.
The tutorial is over! If you get stuck, you can tap the "Help" icon on any screen to get more information, or replay the tutorial from the settings menu. Happy blacksmithing!
